snippet: The largest increases in 2012 were in cities with populations between 500,000 and one million people, according to the F.B.I.
abstract: Preliminary data released by Federal Bureau of Investigation shows that violent crime rose in United States in 2012 for first time in six years.
lead_paragraph: The largest increases in 2012 were in cities with populations between 500,000 and one million people, according to the F.B.I.

headline.seo: Violent Crime in U.S. Rises for First Time Since 2006
headline.main: Violent Crime in U.S. Rises for First Time Since 2006
headline.print_headline: Violent Crime In U.S. Rises For First Time Since 2006
